title: TraFlow: Trajectory Distillation on Pre-Trained Rectified Flow
author: Zhangkai Wu (Macquarie University), Xuhui Fan (Macquarie University), Hongyu Wu (Macquarie University), Longbing Cao (Macquarie University)
relevance_why: The trajectory distillation methods proposed in this paper could enhance audio generation processes by improving sample efficiency and quality, relevant for text-to-audio synthesis.
background: The task involves simplifying the generative process of diffusion models to produce high-quality images or audio samples in fewer steps.
contribution: This paper introduces TraFlow, a model that distills pre-trained rectified flows into a one-step generator, achieving effective sample generation with fewer iterations.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods primarily focused on either output quality or trajectory consistency, which often required iterative sampling steps.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work integrates the advantages of consistency and rectified flows, enforcing both self-consistency and straight trajectories throughout the entire generative process.

key_innovation: TraFlow combines self-consistency and velocity approximation to create smoother trajectories for faster and high-quality sample generation.
real_world_impact: By reducing the number of required sampling steps, TraFlow can be applied in real-time applications where rapid generation is crucial, such as in gaming or multimedia content creation.
limitations: Limited scalability when applied to more complex data distributions beyond what was evaluated.

new_terms.trajectory distillation: **Trajectory distillation** refers to the method of simplifying the generative path from noise to data by modeling and improving the entire sampling trajectory.
new_terms.self-consistency: **Self-consistency** is a property that requires the outputs of a system to be stable over multiple evaluations given the same input conditions.
